intro: Lechea racemulosa, commonly known as the clustered milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a distinguishing botanical feature. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually small and clustered in racemes, giving it its scientific name. The leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
